subject: Pro X Ultra pedals - problem with haptics (??)
description_text:
Hi

I have purchased directly from your website the pedals Pro X Ultra with the
VAM Pro haptics in July 2025.

Right from the start, always had a few problems with haptics disconnecting
every once in a while. Tried pretty much everything I've researched in the
Web, like buying a ferrite USB cable, using a USB ground loop isolator and
grounding the pedals and control box.
This did not solve the issues but made it manageable, and 95% of the time
pedals and haptics worked and when they disconnected, unplugging and
plugging the USB made everything ok.

A few days ago everything stopped working, pedals disconnect after 2 or 3
minutes, haptics start vibrating non-stop and the usual method of
unplug and re-plug doesn't work anymore. I have changed nothing and, as far
as I know, this happened suddenly.

I've tried everything, disconnected everything, connected back, checked all
wiring and connections, re-installed the program manager, reinstalled
firmware etc etc and the problem persists.

If I disconnect the haptics, the pedals alone are working, but I want to
use (and paid for) the haptics together with the pedals.

Can you please let me know how can I resolve this situation? The product is
still under guarantee and should work without any issues.

Thank you

Eduardo

conversations.body_text: Hi Eduardo Mendes,     ProX / ProX Ultra Pedal Firmware Update Procedure:    Press and hold the Upgrade button on the control box;    Reconnect the USB cable;    The software will indicate that the device has entered “Simsonn Flasher Mode”;    In the software, go to: Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals → firmware → select proxultra.sfu from the attachment to update and test (Target versions: CPU1: 2.0.6 / CPU2: 2.0.4);    Start the firmware update. Once completed, release the Upgrade button;    Finally, retest and recalibrate the pedals.

Hi

Thank you for your reply.

I am unable to put the device on Flash Mode, I've tried the steps you
mention and it never goes into Flasher Mode.

But, I was able to update the firmware to the version you have sent, but
the issues persist. The pedals and haptics will disconnect after a few
minutes.

Is there anything more I can do?

Thank you

Hi Eduardo Mendes,      If this occurs, it indicates that your PC’s grounding may be unreliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used in a grounded wall outlet. You can refer to the post below and connect the three metal screws on the PC case, control box, and pedals, which should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Hi

Thank you for your effort in trying to get a resolution.

Grounding is not the problem, the PC and pedals are connected to a PSU and
the PSU is connected to a proper grounded outlet.

On top of that I already have a grounding cable between the pedals and
control box as suggested.

Lack of grounding does not explain the problem. Everything worked fine for
6 months and then suddenly stopped working?
If grounding was a problem, it would be since day 1.

It seems to me the control box is malfunctioning for some reason, is it not
possible to have a replacement?

Thank you.
Hi Eduardo Mendes,  Please provide your order number, and we will send you a replacement control box.

Hi

Thank you
